text:
Stocks in Asia declined with U.S. equity-index futures after President Donald Trump delivered a warning to North Korea amid rising tensions between the nations. The Singapore-traded SGX Nifty, an early indicator of NSE Nifty 50 index’s performance in India, was little changed at 10,007 as of 6:30 a.m.






Global Cues






U.S. stocks fell and a measure of equity volatility spiked higher after President Donald Trump delivered a warning to North Korea amid rising tensions between the nations.





#BQMarketsNow | Geopolitical tensions, volatility drag U.S. stocks lower.https://t.co/E4D8jX9O49 pic.twitter.com/rzQ5STKVAK— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) August 9, 2017
title: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On August 9
